title: Rüther + Hübner - customtype - basic
content:
Hello everybody.

Anyone an idea, whats the basic font of this customized logo. The two ü arent the same that why i call it customized. Maybe its just some kind of ligature!? Dont know!?

Thanx for helping: Steven

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070819092031im_/http:/typophile.com/files/R%C3%BCther%20und%20H%C3%BCbner.jpg)

 [‹ (x) delias.com/allmusic.com headers - ITC Officina Sans/MS Trebuchet {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070819092031/http:/typophile.com/node/19441 "Go to previous forum topic") [OOB Pavilion straight connected script ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070819092031/http:/typophile.com/node/19361 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Steven Wulf

comments.content:
I am going to guess the whole thing is hand-drawn. They could have just reused the same “er” in both words. Very hard to tell tho.

You could look at Brush Script. Mistral, or at Bello from Underware for a somewhat similar feel, or try bulking up Charme or Slogan.
